Hmm.  This is very interesting.  For some reason the activitySupport extension point is null.  This should 
never be the case.  I see you have many plug-ins installed... are you also running a modified/patched 
Eclipse base by any chance?

Pascal, do you have any insights here?  Under what circumstances would an extension point we know to 
exist fail to be returned by IExtensionRegistry.getExtensionPoint(...) ?  A casual trot through the code 
makes me think it might be a corrupt table file...

- are you also running a modified/patched 
Eclipse base by any chance?

No I am not. I have downloaded, unzip and started eclipse 3.1. No modifications.
Mo patches.

Just curious is blackdown a supported JRE?
The reporter does not run the latest blackdown BTW.
And the linux in question looks to me like it's a custom build.
And he uses web tools 0.7 which requires GEF & draw2d 3.1 and not 3.01, EMF 2.1
and not EMF 2.0.2 or 2.0.1.
Note also that the install is not straight because the EMF features seems to be
missing too.
Finally it also missing JEM to run WTP.
http://download.eclipse.org/webtools/downloads/drops/S-0.7RC1-200507150303/

This makes for lot of potential problems.
Just my 2 cents.

It is true that I am not using the latest blackdown.
I am working on a custom linux build - I am using Gentoo linux, with kernel 2.6.10.
Part of the plugins are not the latest. Maybe this is the rezson for the error.
